alerts.message:
...A Flood Warning for small streams remains in effect until 1015 am
MDT Thursday for western McCone...eastern Garfield and northwestern
prairie counties...

At 243 PM MDT...lingering rain showers continue across the area. Up
to three inches of rain have already fallen.

While flooding has not yet been reported, small creeks and streams
are expected to continue rising high, and some lower-lying areas are
expected to begin flooding later this evening if they haven't
already. This includes the little and big dry creeks east of Jordan,
uall creek, Nelson creek, McGuire, north and South Rock creek and
Hay Creek.

Some other locations which will experience flooding include Nelson
Creek Recreation Area, Rock Creek Recreation Area, flowing Wells
rest area, hillside, Van Norman, Haxby, Crow Rock, Weldon, and
Watkins.

Precautionary/preparedness actions...

Turn around...don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small
creeks and streams...country roads...farmland...and other low lying
spots.

A Flood Warning means that flooding is imminent or occurring. All
interested parties should take necessary precautions immediately.


Lat...Lon 4804 10639 4799 10608 4800 10587 4687 10575
 4687 10647 4734 10656 4768 10684 4779 10657
 4795 10641


Bmickelson



1011 am MDT Tue may 10 2016

The National Weather Service in Glasgow has issued a

* Flood Warning for small streams in...
 western McCone County in northeastern Montana...
 eastern Garfield County in northeastern Montana...
 northwestern Prairie County in northeastern Montana...

* until 1015 am MDT Thursday

* at 1015 am MDT, from one to three inches of rainfall have occurred
 over the region since Monday afternoon. While flooding has not
 been reported yet, small creeks will start rising by this
 afternoon across the area. This includes the little and big dry
 creeks east of Jordan, uall creek, Nelson creek, McGuire creek,
 north and South Rock creek and Hay Creek. 

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
 Nelson creek rec area...Rock Creek rec area...flowing Wells rest
 area...hillside...Van Norman...Haxby...Crow Rock...Weldon and Watkins.

Precautionary/preparedness actions...

Turn around...don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small
creeks and streams...country roads...farmland...and other low lying
spots.


Lat...Lon 4804 10639 4799 10608 4800 10587 4687 10575
 4687 10647 4734 10656 4768 10684 4779 10657
 4795 10641


Fransen

...Lake Wind Advisory remains in effect until 9 PM MDT this
evening for Fort Peck Lake...

* winds...northwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 35 mph.

* Timing...through early evening.

* Impacts...strong gusty winds will make open waters of the lake
 rough and hazardous...and could result in high waves which may
 tip or swamp smaller craft.

Precautionary/preparedness actions...

Boaters should use extreme caution if venturing onto Fort Peck
Lake. For your personal safety...avoid the open waters. Stay
close to shore or around protected areas.
